data.title: Stony Brook University Athletics
data.meta_description: Jayden Cook (3) Running Back  - 2023: Played all 10 games primarily at wide receiver… caught 35 passes for 346 yards in 2023… led team with four receiving touchdowns…
data.text:
2023: Played all 10 games primarily at wide receiver… caught 35 passes for 346 yards in 2023… led team with four receiving touchdowns… set career highs with seven receptions for 117 yards and two touchdowns at Maine (Sept. 30), marking a Stony Brook season receiving high in touchdowns… at least 40 receiving yards in three games… multiple receptions in every game and reached four receptions in four different games… rushed for 33 yards on 15 attempts… added a rushing score against Monmouth (Nov. 4).

2022: Played in six games… finished the year with 77 carries for 293 yards rushing… also tallied eight catches for 63 yards receiving… returned seven kicks for 134 yards, averaging 19 yards per return… went for 38 yards rushing in the season opener vs. Rhode Island on September 2… totaled 118 all-purpose yards at UMass on September 17, racking up 63 rushing yards, 30 receiving yards, and 25 kick return yards… ran 8 times for 31 yards at Richmond on September 24… had 18 carries for 55 yards and two catches for 14 yards at Fordham on October 15… carried the ball 26 times for a season-best 92 yards in victory over Maine on October 22… rushed four times for 14 yards at UAlbany on October 29… made SportsCenter’s Top 10 plays for a one-handed catch during preseason camp.

2021: Played in 9 games… Totaled 19 carries for 79 yards and a touchdown… rushed for 27 yards and a touchdown at Villanova on November 13.

2020-21: Fall CAA Football Commissioner's Academic Honor Roll… had 20 carries for 57 yards and a touchdown in Spring 2021 season… scored his first career touchdown in season opener vs. Villanova on March 6… rushed 14 times for 44 yards at Delaware on March 13.

AT SPRING VALLEY HIGH SCHOOL: 2018 Rockland County Player of Year and league's Offensive and Defensive Player of Year ... Tallied 1,962 all-purpose yards (including 845 rushing and 634 receiving) with 22 touchdowns as senior ... Had 59 TDs and gained more than 4,000 all-purpose yards during career as running back, receiver and quarterback ... Two-time Super 11 honoree ... Three-time all-state, all-county and all-league ... Three-year letterwinner and two-year captain ... Also lettered in basketball and track.

PERSONAL: Son of Tahnia Wilson ... Has one sibling, Jasiya Lee ... Undeclared major ... Born Feb. 15, 2001.
